text: Alex Pullin (20 September 1987 - 8 July 2020) was an Australian Olympic snowboarder. He was born in Mansfield, Victoria. He competed in the 2010 Winter Olympics, 2014 Winter Olympics and 2018 Winter Olympics. He won the gold medal at the FIS Snowboard World Championships in 2011 and 2013. Pullin died after drowning in a spearfishing accident on 8 July 2020 on the Gold Coast, Queensland. He was 32. ==References== Category:1987 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Competitors at the 2018 Winter Olympics Category:Accidental deaths in Australia Category:Accidental deaths by drowning Category:Olympians for Australia Category:Sportspeople from Victoria (Australia) Category:Snowboarders
title: Alex Pullin
